understanding.developer_understanding_on_unclear_metho: The unclear code is a method in the BinLog class that sets the maximum number of archive retries. It takes an integer parameter and sets the maxArchiveRetries field in the class.
understanding.developer_understanding_on_unclear_code_: The unclear code is related to the configuration of audit logging options in the BinAuditLogger class. It specifically sets the maximum number of archive retries in the audit logging configuration.

config_description: Audit logging - Logs every incoming CQL command request, authentication to a node. See the docs on audit_logging for full details about the various configuration options.
developer_understanding_on_working: The audit_logging_options configuration is used to enable or disable audit logging in the system. When audit logging is enabled, the system logs every incoming CQL command request and authentication to a node. The configuration options include specifying the logger, included/excluded keyspaces, categories, and users.
developer_understanding_on_triggering_fr: The triggering frequency of the audit_logging_options configuration depends on when the enableAuditLog method is called in the system. If audit logging is enabled, the system will trigger the configuration whenever a CQL command request or authentication occurs.
developer_understanding_on_size_impact: The impact of the audit_logging_options configuration on the system is that it adds overhead to the system by logging every incoming CQL command request and authentication. This can potentially impact system performance and resource utilization, especially if audit logging is enabled with a high frequency of requests.
